info.title: Coats of arms

info.author: Catholic Church
info.colour: black, red, yellow/ochre, dark green (often browned)
info.title: Friedrich von Hohenzollern, Bishop of Augsburg, with the Arms of Johann II of Werdenberg, the Ausgburg Bishopric, and His Own Arms

info.author: Catholic Church
info.notes: Untraced copy descibed as 'printed in three colours' (Gilhofer & Ranschburg 1927, no. 27, pl. XXXIII); later printed in up to three colours in Obsequiale Brixinense ([Augsburg]: Erhard Ratdolt, [after 1493 or about 1500]), ISTC io00003000
info.title: Melchior von Meckau, Bishop of Bressanone, with the coats of arms of the bishopric of Bressanone and his family

info.author: Catholic Church
info.title: Printer's mark of Erhard Ratdolt: Arms with Mercury (with crest and mantling; no shading on shield; the caduceus on the left)

info.author: Catholic Church
info.notes: Recut with the tone block on the front rather than the back of the foilage in the upper left corner, as in ISTC id00264000 (1497)
info.title: Printer's mark of Erhard Ratdolt: Arms with Mercury (with crest and mantling; shading on shield, six hatching lines under the helm, and the caduceus on the left)

info.author: Catholic Church
info.title: Printer's mark of Erhard Ratdolt: Arms with Mercury (escutcheon only)

info.author: Catholic Church
info.notes: A later issue has the arms of Christoph von Schachner on the third shield (see ISTC ib01175200); this link is to a hand-coloured impression
info.title: Arms of Friedrich, Count of Öttingen, and The Scala

info.author: Catholic Church
info.notes: A later issue has the arms of the Scala family on the third shield; see ISTC ib01175000

info.title: Arms of Friedrich, Count of Öttingen, and Christoph von Schachner, Prince- Bishops of Passau
